The facility is included in the community emergency response plan developed under Title 42 USC §11003.
Since the only regulated chemicals at the facility are flammable substances, Wayfare Foods coordinates emergency response actions with the local fire department.
Appropriate mechanisms are in place to notify emergency responders when there is a need for a response.

Annual emergency response coordination activities are performed (Section 1.5.1).

Annual notification exercises are performed (Section 1.5.2).

1.5.1 Emergency Response Coordination Activities

The purpose of emergency response coordination activities is to coordinate response needs with local emergency planning and response organizations. The intent is for local response organizations to be made aware of the regulated substance at Wayfare Foods, their quantities, the risks presented by the covered processes, and the resources and capabilities at our facility to respond to an accidental release of a regulated substance. The emergency response coordination activities will consist of the following:
Coordinations will be completed at least annually. Additional coordinations will be made to account for changes at our facility that may affect the community emergency response plan.
Coordinations will include Wayfare Foods’s emergency response plan, updated emergency contact information, and any other information necessary for developing and implementing the local emergency response plan.

Coordination activities will be appropriately documented. The coordination records will include the names of individuals involved and their contact information (phone number, email address, and organizational affiliations), dates of coordination activities, and nature of coordination activities.

ck, and document events, Wayfare Foods has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP/PSM Program implementation.

Wayfare Foods considers the RMP/PSM Program a “living document”. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Wayfare Foods employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP/PSM Program Wayfare Foods will continue to maintain overall plant worker, public, and environmental safety.

1.5.2 Emergency Response Notification Exercises

At least once per calendar year, Wayfare Foods will conduct an exercise of the facility’s emergency response notifications mechanism. The facility will record each notification exercise utilizing PSMWriter.

Alternatively, the facility may meet the notification requirements through other exercises conducted to meet other Federal, state or local requirements, provided that the necessary notification is performed. Additionally, if a notification is made in response to an accidental release, this would also satisfy the notification requirement.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Wayfare Foods has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker, public, and environmental safety. Nevertheless, Wayfare Foods continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP/PSM Program. This has improved Wayfare Foods’ ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP/PSM related events so that Wayfare Foods’ management team can ensure that the RMP/PSM Program is being implemented.

Wayfare Foods has implemented all aspects of the RMP/PSM Program. When a RMP/PSM Program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.
In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, tra

ntative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.
Wayfare Foods has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Wayfare Foods facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Wayfare Foods has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Wayfare Foods’ emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans – Title 29 CFR §1910.38
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements] – Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] – Title 40 CFR §68.90-96
Federal “Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response” (HAZWOPER) – Title 29 CFR §1910.120(q)

Strategically, Wayfare Foods has chosen to be a non-responding stationary source. Our employees will not respond to ac

t information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP/PSM Program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

Facility Overview

Wayfare Foods operates a food processing plant for vegan dairy free substitutes in Nebraska City, NE. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
(4) Process Rooms
(2) Packaging Rooms
(2) Clean Rooms
(2) Cold Storage Rooms
(2) Hallways
(1) Receiving Dock
(1) Shipping Dock

Facility Location

Wayfare Foods is located at 1320 S 19th St, Nebraska City, NE 68410. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 40.664183, -95.869314. The facility is located approximately 0.7 miles north of interstate 75 in a rural area surrounded primarily by housing.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located adjacent to “a special flood hazard area”. 

A review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Wayfare Foods had a <1% chance of experiencing “potentially minor-damage” due to ground shaking in 2018.
Description of Covered Process

The make up air units are each supplied from an integral surge drum while other air-cooling evaporators and heat exchangers are supplied by the recirculator. As such, the system is configured for both flooded and pumped overfeed operation.

Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Wayfare Foods consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Wayfare Foods is treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meetings we also discuss preve

Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) – Title 40 CFR §68
Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program – Title 29 CFR §1910.119
Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP/PSM Program.

This program is intended to be a “living document”. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Wayfare Foods has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP/PSM related activities. 

1.1 Wayfare Foods, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Wayfare Foods has developed their unified RMP/PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which has the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                 |   Process Chemical             |    Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration   Anhydrous Ammonia           14,000

Our RMP/PSM Program promotes overall plant, worker, public, and environmental safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevan
